computer_extension_attribute.name: 800-53r5_moderate - os_firewall_log_enable
computer_extension_attribute.description:
Firewall logging _MUST_ be enabled.
Firewall logging ensures that malicious network activity will be logged to the system.
NOTE: The firewall data is logged to Apple's Unified Logging with the subsystem com.apple.alf and the data is marked as private.

input_type.script:
#!/bin/zsh #####----- Rule: os_firewall_log_enable -----##### ## Addresses the following NIST 800-53 controls: # * AU-12 # * SC-7 rule_arch="" plb="/usr/libexec/PlistBuddy" # setup files audit_plist_managed="/Library/Managed Preferences/org.800-53r5_moderate.audit.plist"
if [[ ! -e "$audit_plist_managed" ]];then audit_plist_managed="/Library/Preferences/org.800-53r5_moderate.audit.plist" fi
audit_plist="/Library/Preferences/org.800-53r5_moderate.audit.plist" audit_log="/Library/Logs/800-53r5_moderate_baseline.log" if [[ "$arch" == "$rule_arch" ]] || [[ -z "$rule_arch" ]]; then #echo 'Running the command to check the settings for: os_firewall_log_enable ...' unset result_value result_value=$(/usr/libexec/ApplicationFirewall/socketfilterfw --getloggingmode | /usr/bin/grep -c "Log mode is on") # expected result {'integer': 1}
# check to see if rule is exempt unset exempt unset exempt_reason exempt=$($plb -c "print os_firewall_log_enable:exempt" "$audit_plist_managed" 2>/dev/null) exempt_reason=$($plb -c "print os_firewall_log_enable:exempt_reason" "$audit_plist_managed" 2>/dev/null)
if [[ ! $exempt == "true" ]] || [[ -z $exempt ]];then if [[ $result_value == "1" ]]; then echo "<result>os_firewall_log_enable passed (Result: $result_value, Expected: "{'integer': 1}")</result>"
else echo "<result>os_firewall_log_enable failed (Result: $result_value, Expected: "{'integer': 1}")</result>"
fi elif [[ ! -z "$exempt_reason" ]];then echo "<result>os_firewall_log_enable has an exemption (Reason: "$exempt_reason")</result>"
/bin/sleep 1 fi else echo "<result>os_firewall_log_enable does not apply to this architechture</result>" fi
